==Early life and education==
==Early life and education==
â
Semenya was born in Ga-Masehlong, a village in [[South Africa]] near [[Polokwane]] and grew up in the village of Fairlie, "deep in South Africa's northern [[Limpopo]] province."<ref name="Birth certificate backs SA gender"/><ref name=Mail/> She has three sisters and a brother and the family are members of the [[Zion Christian Church]].<ref name=Mail>{{cite web|url= http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/worldnews/article-1208227/She-wouldnt-wear-dresses-sounds-like-man-phone-Caster-Semenyas-father-sex-riddle-daughter.html |title= 'He wouldn't wear dresses and sounds like a man on the phone': Caster Semenya's father on his sex-riddle daughter |date=23 August 2009|publisher=''[[Daily Mail]]'' |accessdate=27 August 2009}}</ref> As a child, she is said to have been a [[tomboy]].<ref name=Mail/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.universalsports.com/ViewArticle.dbml?DB_OEM_ID=23000&ATCLID=204778766|title=Caster Semenya's present and future|last=Abrahamson|first=Alan|date=20 August 2009|publisher=[[Universal Sports]]|accessdate=30 August 2009}}</ref> At the age of fourteen, she was disqualified from girls' football for being too rough. Later, she renewed an interest in running and began to compete.<ref name=Mail/>
+
Semenya was born in Ga-Masehlong, a village in [[South Africa]] near [[Polokwane]] and grew up in the village of Fairlie, "deep in South Africa's northern [[Limpopo]] province."<ref name="Birth certificate backs SA gender"/><ref name=Mail/> She has three sisters and a brother and the family are members of the [[Zion Christian Church]].<ref name=Mail>{{cite web|url= http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/worldnews/article-1208227/She-wouldnt-wear-dresses-sounds-like-man-phone-Caster-Semenyas-father-sex-riddle-daughter.html |title= 'SHe wouldn't wear dresses and sounds like a man on the phone': Caster Semenya's father on his sex-riddle daughter |date=23 August 2009|publisher=''[[Daily Mail]]'' |accessdate=27 August 2009}}</ref> As a child, she is said to have been a [[tomboy]].<ref name=Mail/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.universalsports.com/ViewArticle.dbml?DB_OEM_ID=23000&ATCLID=204778766|title=Caster Semenya's present and future|last=Abrahamson|first=Alan|date=20 August 2009|publisher=[[Universal Sports]]|accessdate=30 August 2009}}</ref> At the age of fourteen, she was disqualified from girls' football for being too rough. Later, she renewed an interest in running and began to compete.<ref name=Mail/>
Semenya attended Nthema Secondary School and now attends [[Pretoria University]] as a first-year [[sports science]] student.<ref name=Times/><ref> [http://www.wistv.com/Global/story.asp?S=10963679 SAfrican in gender flap gets gold for 800 win] 22 August 2009, By RYAN LUCAS, Associated Press Writer</ref> Semenya began running to train for [[association football]].<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.thetimes.co.za/News/Article.aspx?id=1057364 |title=Hero Casterâs road to gold|last=Prince |first=Chandre|date=29 August 2009|publisher=[[The Times]]|accessdate=30 August 2009}}</ref>
Semenya attended Nthema Secondary School and now attends [[Pretoria University]] as a first-year [[sports science]] student.<ref name=Times/><ref> [http://www.wistv.com/Global/story.asp?S=10963679 SAfrican in gender flap gets gold for 800 win] 22 August 2009, By RYAN LUCAS, Associated Press Writer</ref> Semenya began running to train for [[association football]].<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.thetimes.co.za/News/Article.aspx?id=1057364 |title=Hero Casterâs road to gold|last=Prince |first=Chandre|date=29 August 2009|publisher=[[The Times]]|accessdate=30 August 2009}}</ref>
